metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34141 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An incomplete string comparison in the numpy.core component in NumPy before 1.22.0 allows attackers to trigger slightly incorrect copying by constructing specific string objects. NOTE: the vendor states that this reported code behavior is "completely harmless."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-numpy - 1:1.17.4-5ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: numpy package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.17.4-5ubuntu3.1').
